page.title: 05Interesting Local Characters
page.content: {Mr Appleby}is chairman of the governors for our school.He works voluntarily for the Victim Support Scheme to help people who have been robbed.He used to play soccer,tennis, table-tennis and cricket.He went to the North Board School and then to St.Helena's School. He was one of the first people to pass the 13+ at St.Helena's and he went to the Junior Technical School which is now the old Gilberd.Mr.Appleby also participates in morris dancing. {Mrs Wyncoll}and her husband owned 196 acres of land where st John's estate is now,about 35-50 years ago.There were no houses,only their farmhouse on St Monance Way.Before Mrs Wyncoll lived there she lived at Elmstead Hall. Wyncoll Road is named after her husbands grandfather.Hay was grown where Friars Grove School now stands.
